abstract: Civilian oversight committee for Los Angeles Police Dept rules that Officer Sharlton Wampler behaved improperly throughout confrontation with Ezell Ford, mentally ill black man who was shot dead in 2014 encounter; says Officer Antonio Villegas should not have drawn his weapon, but was ultimately justified in firing on Ford; officers' fates are now left with Police Chief Charlie Beck.
lead_paragraph: The Board of Police Commissioners, a civilian oversight committee, found some fault with two officers in the shooting of Ezell Ford in August.

headline.main: Los Angeles Police Officers Acted Improperly in Ezell Ford Shooting, Civilian Board Says
